e4: The ethical considerations of transparency and honest reporting are paramount. While the short-term market reaction might be negative, building trust with investors in the long run is more valuable.  The current policy, though seemingly successful, is ethically questionable and unsustainable.  Adopting the new policy is the right course of action, even if it presents some initial challenges.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency, accuracy, and fairness.  It ensures that all relevant information is disclosed without bias or manipulation, allowing investors to make informed decisions.  It considers the potential impact on all stakeholders, including retail investors who may be more vulnerable to misinformation.  Consistency over time and clear communication of any policy changes are also crucial for building and maintaining trust.
e6: I would ask about the specific strategies for communicating the policy change to investors, mitigating potential short-term market negativity, and educating retail investors about the change.  I'd also want to understand a detailed risk assessment of the transition and explore alternative communication plans to reduce investor confusion.
